abstracts.cdata!:
The assessment rates the project outcome
            as satisfactory based on its high relevance, substantial
            efficacy, and substantial efficiency. The assessment rates
            sustainability as likely, and institutional development
            impact as substantial; it rates Bank performance as
            satisfactory and borrower performance also satisfactory. The
            key lessons from the project are as follows: Good
            preparation is important, but must allow for a realistic
            time frame. For policy/institutional restructuring projects,
            it should set out the broad study direction and assist the
            borrower to take full ownership of the process, which should
            be fine-tuned as the project proceeds, with full input from
            the key sector players. The project preparation plan should
            include an assessment of possible risks. In the event that
            the project experiences internal and/or external shocks
            necessitating institutional restructuring, such
            restructuring can best be expedited through a flexible
            approach and good supervision. 0 Key elements of a
            project's policy and institutional development agenda
            may still be completed after a project's closing date
            if the project staff and consultants have nurtured an
            appropriate relationship for that agenda and remain engaged,
            if possible, beyond project closing.

4243864.owner: Fin, Private Sec & Infrastructur (LCSFP),Sustainable Development Dept (LCSSD),Transport (LCSTR)
4243864.trustfund:
TF036250-LAC REGION  - TRANSPORT SECTOR
            (HONDURAS, COSTA RICA, GUATEMALA),TF037507-HONDURAS - TRANSPORT SECTOR REHABILITATION

abstracts.cdata!:
The outcome of the Transport Sector
            Rehabilitation Project is rated as satisfactory,
            sustainability as likely, institutional development impact
            as substantial, Bank performance as satisfactory, and
            Borrower performance as satisfactory. The key lessons
            learned from the project implementation include: 1) The
            promptness of IDA's response to the devastating effects
            of Hurricane Mitch as instrumental in preserving the
            benefits of the project. IDA's continued assistance
            helped the Ministry of Public Works, Transport and Housing
            (SOPTRAVI) in keeping a long-term view while attending to
            the reconstruction effort, as illustrated by the
            incorporation of strategic lessons learned from Hurricane
            Mitch and the implementation of long-term reforms to enhance
            road maintenance sustainability. 2) Project implementation
            shows that the engagement of a private consulting firm,
            composed mainly of engineers who were formerly employed by
            SOPTRAVI, facilitated project coordination and enabled the
            provision of high-quality technical support. 3) The project,
            with its strong emphasis on sector-wide reforms, implied a
            departure from previous operations in the sector. Taking
            advantage of the window opportunity, the project contributed
            to carrying the reform message through two administrations,
            albeit with varying degrees of success among sub-sectors.
            The outcome proved successful in the aviation and road sub-sectors.
